recipe.title: Cookbook:Baked Potatoes
recipe.description: __NOTOC__ | Cooking techniques | Camp Cooking | Microwave Cooking
instructions: Scrub potato on all sides to clean the surface.
Pierce skin of potato with a fork or small-tipped object to create holes for inside pressure.
Clean and prepare potatoes as above.
Cook over medium-hot coals for 45 minutes or until soft.
Serve with salt and butter or sour cream.

Clean and prepare potatoes as above, but wrap them in plastic wrap, not foil. Be sure to poke the potato and the plastic wrap with a fork to make sure it is cooked evenly and does not explode in the microwave due to pressure.
Place a piece of paper towel in the microwave, and microwave potatoes on high for 8 minutes. Potatoes will be extremely hot when finished.
Cut potato into four and serve with toppings of your choice.
Clean and prepare potatoes as above.
Place the potatoes in the oven.
Remove when cooked. Puncture potato and separate skin from flesh.
notes: Other possible toppings include spicy beans, avocado, salsa, bacon bits, mushrooms grated cheese... or whatever is left in the fridge!

metadata.description: Microwaved potatoes (they can also be baked in foil over a fire or in the oven), with toppings: sour cream (partly melted at the front), spicy Mexican beans, mushrooms and grated cheese.
categories: Baked potato with cream and cheese
